dom-evt-encrypted.name: encrypted_event
dom-evt-encrypted.summary: The encrypted event is fired when the media encounters some initialization data indicating it is encrypted.
dom-evt-encrypted.title: HTMLMediaElement: encrypted event

dom-htmlmediaelement-onencrypted.name: encrypted_event
dom-htmlmediaelement-onencrypted.summary: The encrypted event is fired when the media encounters some initialization data indicating it is encrypted.
dom-htmlmediaelement-onencrypted.title: HTMLMediaElement: encrypted event

dom-htmlmediaelement-mediakeys.name: mediaKeys
dom-htmlmediaelement-mediakeys.summary: The read-only HTMLMediaElement.mediaKeys property returns a MediaKeys object, that is a set of keys that the element can use for decryption of media data during playback.
dom-htmlmediaelement-mediakeys.title: HTMLMediaElement: mediaKeys property

dom-htmlmediaelement-setmediakeys.name: setMediaKeys
dom-htmlmediaelement-setmediakeys.summary: The setMediaKeys() method of the HTMLMediaElement interface returns a Promise that resolves to the passed MediaKeys, which are those used to decrypt media during playback.
dom-htmlmediaelement-setmediakeys.title: HTMLMediaElement: setMediaKeys() method

dom-mediaencryptedevent.name: MediaEncryptedEvent
dom-mediaencryptedevent.summary: The MediaEncryptedEvent constructor creates a new MediaEncryptedEvent object.
dom-mediaencryptedevent.title: MediaEncryptedEvent: MediaEncryptedEvent() constructor

dom-mediaencryptedevent-initdata.name: initData
dom-mediaencryptedevent-initdata.summary: The read-only initData property of the MediaKeyMessageEvent returns the initialization data contained in this event, if any.
dom-mediaencryptedevent-initdata.title: MediaEncryptedEvent: initData property

dom-mediaencryptedevent-initdatatype.name: initDataType
dom-mediaencryptedevent-initdatatype.summary: The read-only initDataType property of the MediaKeyMessageEvent returns a case-sensitive string describing the type of the initialization data associated with this event.
dom-mediaencryptedevent-initdatatype.title: MediaEncryptedEvent: initDataType property

mediaencryptedevent.name: MediaEncryptedEvent
mediaencryptedevent.summary: The MediaEncryptedEvent interface of the Encrypted Media Extensions API contains the information associated with an encrypted event sent to a HTMLMediaElement when some initialization data is encountered in the media.
mediaencryptedevent.title: MediaEncryptedEvent

constructors.name: MediaKeyMessageEvent
constructors.summary: The MediaKeyMessageEvent constructor creates a new MediaKeyMessageEvent object.
constructors.title: MediaKeyMessageEvent: MediaKeyMessageEvent() constructor

dom-mediakeymessageevent-message.name: message
dom-mediakeymessageevent-message.summary: The MediaKeyMessageEvent.message read-only property returns an ArrayBuffer with a message from the content decryption module. Messages vary by key system.
dom-mediakeymessageevent-message.title: MediaKeyMessageEvent: message property

dom-mediakeymessageevent-messagetype.name: messageType
dom-mediakeymessageevent-messagetype.summary: The MediaKeyMessageEvent.messageType read-only property indicates the type of message. It may be one of license-request, license-renewal, license-release, or individualization-request.
dom-mediakeymessageevent-messagetype.title: MediaKeyMessageEvent: messageType property

mediakeymessageevent.name: MediaKeyMessageEvent
mediakeymessageevent.summary: The MediaKeyMessageEvent interface of the Encrypted Media Extensions API contains the content and related data when the content decryption module generates a message for the session.
mediakeymessageevent.title: MediaKeyMessageEvent

dom-mediakeysession-close.name: close
dom-mediakeysession-close.summary: The MediaKeySession.close() method notifies that the current media session is no longer needed, and that the content decryption module should release any resources associated with this object and close it. Then, it returns a Promise.
dom-mediakeysession-close.title: MediaKeySession: close() method

dom-mediakeysession-closed.name: closed
dom-mediakeysession-closed.summary: The MediaKeySession.closed read-only property returns a Promise signaling when a MediaKeySession closes. This promise can only be fulfilled and is never rejected. Closing a session means that licenses and keys associated with it are no longer valid for decrypting media data.
dom-mediakeysession-closed.title: MediaKeySession: closed property

dom-mediakeysession-expiration.name: expiration
dom-mediakeysession-expiration.summary: The MediaKeySession.expiration read-only property returns the time after which the keys in the current session can no longer be used to decrypt media data, or NaN if no such time exists. This value is determined by the CDM and measured in milliseconds since January 1, 1970, UTC. This value may change during a session lifetime, such as when an action triggers the start of a window.
dom-mediakeysession-expiration.title: MediaKeySession: expiration property

dom-mediakeysession-generaterequest.name: generateRequest
dom-mediakeysession-generaterequest.summary: The MediaKeySession.generateRequest() method returns a Promise after generating a media request based on initialization data.
dom-mediakeysession-generaterequest.title: MediaKeySession: generateRequest() method

dom-mediakeysession-keystatuses.name: keyStatuses
dom-mediakeysession-keystatuses.summary: The MediaKeySession.keyStatuses read-only property returns a reference to a read-only MediaKeyStatusMap of the current session's keys and their statuses.
dom-mediakeysession-keystatuses.title: MediaKeySession: keyStatuses property

dom-mediakeysession-onkeystatuseschange.name: keystatuseschange_event
dom-mediakeysession-onkeystatuseschange.summary: The keystatuseschange event of the MediaKeySession API fires when there has been a change in the keys or their statuses within a session.

chrome.notes: The onkeystatuseschange event handler property is not supported.

webview_android.notes: The onkeystatuseschange event handler property is not supported.

edge_blink.notes: The onkeystatuseschange event handler property is not supported.

dom-mediakeysession-onkeystatuseschange.title: MediaKeySession: keystatuseschange event

dom-mediakeysession-load.name: load
dom-mediakeysession-load.summary: The MediaKeySession.load() method returns a Promise that resolves to a boolean value after loading data for a specified session object.
dom-mediakeysession-load.title: MediaKeySession: load() method

dom-mediakeysession-onmessage.name: message_event
dom-mediakeysession-onmessage.summary: The message event of the MediaKeySession interface fires when a message is generated by the content decryption module.

chrome.notes: The onmessage event handler property is not supported.

webview_android.notes: The onmessage event handler property is not supported.

edge_blink.notes: The onmessage event handler property is not supported.

dom-mediakeysession-onmessage.title: MediaKeySession: message event

dom-mediakeysession-remove.name: remove
dom-mediakeysession-remove.summary: The MediaKeySession.remove() method returns a Promise after removing any session data associated with the current object.
dom-mediakeysession-remove.title: MediaKeySession: remove() method

dom-mediakeysession-sessionid.name: sessionId
dom-mediakeysession-sessionid.summary: The MediaKeySession.sessionId is a read-only property that contains a unique string generated by the content decryption module (CDM) for the current media object and its associated keys or licenses.
dom-mediakeysession-sessionid.title: MediaKeySession: sessionId property

dom-mediakeysession-update.name: update
dom-mediakeysession-update.summary: The MediaKeySession.update() method loads messages and licenses to the CDM, and then returns a Promise .
dom-mediakeysession-update.title: MediaKeySession: update() method

mediakeysession-interface.name: MediaKeySession
mediakeysession-interface.summary: The MediaKeySession interface of the Encrypted Media Extensions API represents a context for message exchange with a content decryption module (CDM).
mediakeysession-interface.title: MediaKeySession

dom-mediakeystatusmap-get.name: get
dom-mediakeystatusmap-get.summary: The get property of the MediaKeyStatusMap interface returns the value associated with the given key, or undefined if there is none.
dom-mediakeystatusmap-get.title: MediaKeyStatusMap: get() method

dom-mediakeystatusmap-has.name: has
dom-mediakeystatusmap-has.summary: The has property of the MediaKeyStatusMap interface returns a Boolean, asserting whether a value has been associated with the given key.
dom-mediakeystatusmap-has.title: MediaKeyStatusMap: has() method

dom-mediakeystatusmap-size.name: size
dom-mediakeystatusmap-size.summary: The size read-only property of the MediaKeyStatusMap interface returns the number of key/value paIrs in the status map.
dom-mediakeystatusmap-size.title: MediaKeyStatusMap: size property

mediakeystatusmap-interface.name: MediaKeyStatusMap
mediakeystatusmap-interface.summary: The MediaKeyStatusMap interface of the Encrypted Media Extensions API is a read-only map of media key statuses by key IDs.
mediakeystatusmap-interface.title: MediaKeyStatusMap

dom-mediakeysystemaccess-createmediakeys.name: createMediaKeys
dom-mediakeysystemaccess-createmediakeys.summary: The MediaKeySystemAccess.createMediaKeys() method returns a Promise that resolves to a new MediaKeys object.
dom-mediakeysystemaccess-createmediakeys.title: MediaKeySystemAccess: createMediaKeys() method

dom-mediakeysystemaccess-getconfiguratio.name: getConfiguration
dom-mediakeysystemaccess-getconfiguratio.summary: The MediaKeySystemAccess.getConfiguration() method returns an object with the supported combination of the following configuration options:

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 50, the returned object has neither a distinctiveIdentifier nor a persistentState property.

dom-mediakeysystemaccess-getconfiguratio.title: MediaKeySystemAccess: getConfiguration() method

dom-mediakeysystemaccess-keysystem.name: keySystem
dom-mediakeysystemaccess-keysystem.summary: The MediaKeySystemAccess.keySystem read-only property returns a string identifying the key system being used.
dom-mediakeysystemaccess-keysystem.title: MediaKeySystemAccess: keySystem property

mediakeysystemaccess-interface.name: MediaKeySystemAccess
mediakeysystemaccess-interface.summary: The MediaKeySystemAccess interface of the Encrypted Media Extensions API provides access to a Key System for decryption and/or a content protection provider. You can request an instance of this object using the Navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess() method.
mediakeysystemaccess-interface.title: MediaKeySystemAccess

dom-mediakeys-createsession.name: createSession
dom-mediakeys-createsession.summary: The MediaKeys.createSession() method returns a new MediaKeySession object, which represents a context for message exchange with a content decryption module (CDM).
dom-mediakeys-createsession.title: MediaKeys: createSession() method

dom-mediakeys-setservercertificate.name: setServerCertificate
dom-mediakeys-setservercertificate.summary: The MediaKeys.setServerCertificate() method provides a server certificate to be used to encrypt messages to the license server.
dom-mediakeys-setservercertificate.title: MediaKeys: setServerCertificate() method

mediakeys-interface.name: MediaKeys
mediakeys-interface.summary: The MediaKeys interface of Encrypted Media Extensions API represents a set of keys that an associated HTMLMediaElement can use for decryption of media data during playback.
mediakeys-interface.title: MediaKeys

navigator-extension-requestmediakeysyste.name: requestMediaKeySystemAccess
navigator-extension-requestmediakeysyste.summary: The Navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess() method returns a Promise which delivers a MediaKeySystemAccess object that can be used to access a particular media key system, which can in turn be used to create keys for decrypting a media stream. This method is part of the Encrypted Media Extensions API, which brings support for encrypted media and DRM-protected video to the web.

notes: The spec requires that the passed supportedConfigurations option contain at least one of audioCapabilities or videoCapabilities, and that said parameters include a codec string.
The function does not exist in insecure contexts. This was not enforced until Chrome 58.
Starting in Firefox 55, if neither audioCapabilities nor videoCapabilities is specified in supportedConfigurations, a warning is output to the web console.

In addition, starting in Firefox 55, if in supportedConfigurations, either audioCapabilities's or videoCapabilities's contentType value doesn't specify a "codecs" substring to define allowed codecs within the media wrapper, a warning is output to the web console. See note below table for example and correction.
In the future, if neither audioCapabilities nor videoCapabilities is specified in the supportedConfigurations, a NotSupported exception will be thrown.
The spec requires that the passed supportedConfigurations option contain at least one of audioCapabilities or videoCapabilities, and that said parameters include a codec string.
The function does not exist in insecure contexts. This was not enforced until Opera 45.
The spec requires that the passed supportedConfigurations option contain at least one of audioCapabilities or videoCapabilities, and that said parameters include a codec string.
The function does not exist in insecure contexts. This was not enforced until version 58.
The spec requires that the passed supportedConfigurations option contain at least one of audioCapabilities or videoCapabilities, and that said parameters include a codec string.
The function does not exist in insecure contexts. This was not enforced until Chrome 58.

navigator-extension-requestmediakeysyste.title: Navigator: requestMediaKeySystemAccess() method

permissions-policy-integration.name: encrypted-media
permissions-policy-integration.summary: The HTTP Permissions-Policy header encrypted-media directive controls whether the current document is allowed to use the Encrypted Media Extensions API (EME).
permissions-policy-integration.title: Permissions-Policy: encrypted-media

permissions-policy-integration.name: encrypted-media
permissions-policy-integration.summary: The HTTP Permissions-Policy header encrypted-media directive controls whether the current document is allowed to use the Encrypted Media Extensions API (EME).
permissions-policy-integration.title: Permissions-Policy: encrypted-media
